Information: CYP2D6 is a crucial enzyme in the cytochrome P450 enzyme system, predominantly found in the liver. It plays a significant role in the metabolism of various drugs, including antibiotics and other medications.

CYP3A4 plays a critical role in the oxidative metabolism of drugs, facilitating their transformation into more water-soluble compounds that can be eliminated from the body. This process is vital for maintaining drug levels within a therapeutic range and preventing toxicity.
